SyncRequest.description: A SyncRequest is sent to a FlioxHub targeting a specific database.

req.description:
Used only for RemoteClientHub to enable:

1. Out of order response handling for their corresponding requests.

2. Multiplexing of requests and their responses for multiple clients e.g. FlioxClient using the same connection. This is not a common scenario but it enables using a single WebSocketClientHub used by multiple clients.

The host itself only echos the reqId to reqId and does not utilize it internally.

clt.description:
As a user can access a FlioxHub by multiple clients the clientId enables identifying each client individually.
The clientId is used for SubscribeMessage and SubscribeChanges to enable sending SyncEvent's to the desired subscriber.

user.description: Identify the user performing a sync request. In case using of using UserAuthenticator the userId and token are use for user authentication.

ack.description: eventAck is used to ensure (change) events are delivered reliable. A client set eventAck to the last received seq in case it has subscribed to database changes by a SubscribeChanges task. Otherwise eventAck is null.

tasks.description: list of tasks either container operations or database commands / messages

database.description: database name the tasks apply to. null to access the default database

info.description: optional JSON value - can be used to describe a request

SyncResponse.description: A SyncResponse is the response of SyncRequest executed by a FlioxHub

req.description: Set to the value of the corresponding reqId of a ProtocolRequest

clt.description: Set to clientId of a SyncRequest in case the given clientId was valid. Otherwise it is set to null.

database.description: for debugging - not used by Protocol

tasks.description: list of task results corresponding to the tasks in a SyncRequest

containers.description: entities as results from the tasks in a SyncRequest grouped by container

ContainerEntities.description: Used by SyncResponse to return the entities as results from tasks of a SyncRequest

cont.description: container name the of the returned entities

count.description: number of entities - not utilized by Protocol

set.description: all entities from the container resulting from ReadEntities and QueryEntities tasks of a SyncRequest

notFound.description: list of entities not found by ReadEntities tasks

errors.description: list of entity errors read from container

ErrorResponse.description: ErrorResponse is returned for a SyncRequest in case the whole requests failed

req.description: Set to the value of the corresponding reqId of a ProtocolRequest

clt.description: Set to clientId of a SyncRequest in case the given clientId was valid. Otherwise it is set to null.

type.description: error type: invalid request or execution exception

descriptions.BadRequest: Invalid JSON request or invalid request parameters. Maps to HTTP status code 400 (Bad Request)
descriptions.Exception: Internal exception. Maps to HTTP status code 500 (Internal Server Error)
descriptions.BadResponse: Invalid JSON response. Maps to HTTP status code 500 (Internal Server Error)

EventMessage.description: Contains a set of SyncEvent's. It is send as a push message to clients to deliver the events subscribed by these clients.

clt.description:
The target client the event is sent to. This enables sharing a single (WebSocket) connection by multiple clients.
In many scenarios this property is redundant as every client uses a WebSocket exclusively.

seq.description: Increasing event sequence number starting with 1 for a specific target client dstClientId. Each target client (subscriber) has its own sequence.

ev.description: Each SyncEvent corresponds to a SyncRequest and contains the subscribed messages and container changes in its tasks field

SyncEvent.description: A SyncEvent corresponds to a SyncRequest and contains the subscribed messages and container changes in its tasks field

usr.description:
The user which caused the event. Specifically the user which made a database change or sent a message / command.
By default it is set always. If not required set SendEventUserId to false.

clt.description:
The client which caused the event. Specifically the client which made a database change or sent a message / command.
By default it set only if the subscriber is the origin of the event to enable ignoring the event.
It is set in any case if SendEventClientId is true.

tasks.description:
Contains the events an application subscribed. These are:
CreateEntities, UpsertEntities, DeleteEntities, SendMessage, SendCommand
